data.event: Albany was laid out in about 1832.

event.title: was incorporated as a village in 1842

data.event: It was incorporated as a village in 1842.

event.title: increased during the 1850s from four in the township to 174 by 1860

data.event: The black population increased during the 1850s from four in the township to 174 by 1860, largely because of the chance for their children to attend the Albany Manual Labor Academy, which was open to both genders and all races.
